opendial.bn.distribs

Interface ProbDistribution

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndependentProbDistribution
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalTable, ConditionalDistribution, ConditionalTable, ContinuousDistribution, EquivalenceDistribution, MarginalDistribution, OutputDistribution, RuleDistribution

    public interface ProbDistribution
    Representation of a conditional probability distribution P(X | Y1,...Ym), where X is the "head" random variable for the distribution, and Y1,...Ym are the conditional variables
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ProbDistribution copy()
      Creates a copy of the probability distribution
      ProbDistribution getPosterior(Assignment condition)
      Returns a new probability distribution that is the posterior of the current distribution, given the conditional assignment as argument.
      double getProb(Assignment condition, Value head)
      Returns the probability P(head|condition), if any is specified.
      IndependentProbDistribution getProbDistrib(Assignment condition)
      Returns the (unconditional) probability distribution associated with the conditional assignment provided as argument.
      java.util.Set<Value> getValues()
      Returns the set of possible values for the distribution.
      java.lang.String getVariable()
      Returns the name of the random variable
      boolean isWellFormed()
      Checks that the probability distribution is well-formed (all assignments are covered, and the probabilities add up to 1.0f)
      void modifyVariableId(java.lang.String oldId, java.lang.String newId)
      Changes the variable name in the distribution
      boolean pruneValues(double threshold)
      Prunes values whose frequency in the distribution is lower than the given threshold.
      Value sample(Assignment condition)
      Returns a sample value for the distribution given a particular conditional assignment.

    • Method Detail

      • getVariable

        java.lang.String getVariable()
        Returns the name of the random variable
        Returns:
        the name of the random variable

      • getProb

        double getProb(Assignment condition,
               Value head)
        throws DialException
        Returns the probability P(head|condition), if any is specified. Else, returns 0.0f.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1,..., Ym
        head - the value for the random variable
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.
        Throws:
        DialException - if the probability could not be extracted

      • getProbDistrib

        IndependentProbDistribution getProbDistrib(Assignment condition)
                                    throws DialException
        Returns the (unconditional) probability distribution associated with the conditional assignment provided as argument.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment on Y1,...Ym
        Returns:
        the independent probability distribution on X.
        Throws:
        DialException - if the unconditional distribution could not be extracted

      • sample

        Value sample(Assignment condition)
      throws DialException
        Returns a sample value for the distribution given a particular conditional assignment.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1,...,Ym
        Returns:
        the sampled values for the random variable
        Throws:
        DialException - if no value(s) could be sampled

      • getValues

        java.util.Set<Value> getValues()
                        throws DialException
        Returns the set of possible values for the distribution. If the distribution is continuous, the method returns a discretised set.
        Throws:
        DialException - if the values could not be extracted

      • getPosterior

        ProbDistribution getPosterior(Assignment condition)
                       throws DialException
        Returns a new probability distribution that is the posterior of the current distribution, given the conditional assignment as argument.
        Parameters:
        condition - an assignment of values to (a subset of) the conditional variables
        Returns:
        the posterior distribution
        Throws:
        DialException - if the posterior could not be computed.

      • pruneValues

        boolean pruneValues(double threshold)
        Prunes values whose frequency in the distribution is lower than the given threshold.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the threshold to apply for the pruning
        Returns:
        true if at least one value has been removed, false otherwise

      • isWellFormed

        boolean isWellFormed()
        Checks that the probability distribution is well-formed (all assignments are covered, and the probabilities add up to 1.0f)
        Returns:
        true is the distribution is well-formed, false otherwise

      • copy

        ProbDistribution copy()
        Creates a copy of the probability distribution
        Returns:
        the copy

      • modifyVariableId

        void modifyVariableId(java.lang.String oldId,
                      java.lang.String newId)
        Changes the variable name in the distribution
        Parameters:
        oldId - the old variable label
        newId - the new variable label
